title: Front ABS Wheel Speed Sensor - Removal

body.body: Front ABS Wheel Speed Sensor - Removal
Before starting work, ensure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Seat and Battery - remove D54; DC; DC3; DC4
Disconnect the battery, negative (black) lead first (see
Seat and Battery - remove - D72; D92; DB; DB2; DBX; DC3; DC4; DP; DP2; DP3; DP4; DPA; DT3; DU; DU3; DUY; DZ
Disconnect the battery, negative (black) lead first (see

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: D54; D64; DC3; DC4; DP4; D72; D92; DB2; DU3; DT3; DP3; DP2; DZ; DBX; DB; DUY; DU; DPA; DP

body.body: Remove the headlight from the headlight bowl (see
Disconnect the wheel speed sensor electrical connector from the main harness, located inside the headlight.
Note the routing of the wheel speed sensor harness and it clips for installation.
Detach the front ABS wheel speed sensor harness from the clips on the front brake line.
There is a shim between the wheel speed sensor and the front fork leg.
Release the fixing securing the wheel speed sensor to the fork leg.
Remove the wheel speed sensor and collect the shim.
